title.value: An Examination of the Robustness of Reference-Free Image Captioning Evaluation Metrics
title.justification: This title represents the focus of the research on evaluating the robustness of metrics for image captioning without references.
title.quote: Title: An Examination of the Robustness of Reference-Free Image Captioning Evaluation Metrics

extractions.description: The paper evaluates the robustness of reference-free metrics for image captioning, including CLIPScore, UMIC, and PAC-S, under various conditions to identify their strengths and limitations.

type.justification: The study conducts several controlled experiments to examine the robustness of reference-free metrics in various scenarios, involving data collection, analysis, and evaluation.
type.quote: In this work, we evaluate the robustness of these reference-free metrics in scenarios where the correct and incorrect captions have high lexical overlap... several controlled experiments, varying one aspect at a time.

name.justification: The research is centered around evaluating image captioning metrics, which falls under the domain of Computer Vision.
name.quote: In this work, we evaluate the robustness of these reference-free metrics in scenarios where the correct and incorrect captions have high lexical overlap...

name.justification: The specific focus of the paper is on evaluating metrics for image captioning.
name.quote: Recently, reference-free metrics such as CLIPScore (Hessel et al., 2021), UMIC (Lee et al.,2021), and PAC-S (Sarto et al., 2023) have been proposed for automatic reference-free evaluation of image captions.

name.justification: The paper explores the effectiveness of various evaluation metrics in image captioning.
name.quote: Our focus lies in evaluating the robustness of these metrics in scenarios that require distinguishing between two captions with high lexical overlap but very different meanings.

name.justification: CLIPScore is one of the primary metrics discussed and evaluated in the paper.
name.quote: Recently, reference-free metrics such as CLIPScore (Hessel et al., 2021)

is_contributed.justification: The paper discusses and evaluates CLIPScore but does not claim to have developed it.
is_contributed.quote: Recently, reference-free metrics such as CLIPScore (Hessel et al., 2021)

is_executed.justification: CLIPScore is evaluated using empirical experiments within the paper.
is_executed.quote: We evaluate the robustness of CLIPScore in scenarios...

is_compared.justification: CLIPScore's performance is compared to other metrics like UMIC and PAC-S in the study.
is_compared.quote: Our findings reveal that despite their high correlation with human judgments, CLIPScore, UMIC, and PAC-S struggle to identify fine-grained errors.
